article.title: Catching a star before explosion: the luminous blue variable progenitor of SN 2015bh

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 1 depicts the velocity, density, and optical depth structures of the SN 2015bh progenitor. What is the significance of the red line in this figure?
choices: It represents the temperature structure of the progenitor.
It shows the velocity profile of the progenitor\'s wind, increasing with distance.
It indicates the density of the surrounding interstellar medium.
It depicts the Rosseland optical depth, decreasing with distance from the star.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 2 compares the observed spectrum of SN2015bh (gray) with a synthetic spectrum from a best-fitting model (red).  What can be concluded from the fit to the Hα line shown in panel (c)?
choices: The model perfectly reproduces the observed Hα line profile.
The model slightly underestimates the strength of the Hα emission.
The model significantly overestimates the strength of the Hα emission.
The model fails to reproduce the P-Cygni profile of the Hα line.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows a comparison of the flux-calibrated spectrum of SN2015bh with a best-fit CMFGEN model. What key parameters were constrained by comparing the absolute flux levels of the observed and model spectra?
choices: Wind terminal velocity (v∞) and mass-loss rate (Ṁ)

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 4 displays the formation region of the Hα line as a function of distance from the star. What does the quantity "ġ" in this figure represent?
choices: The Rosseland optical depth of the Hα line
The velocity of the outflow at a given distance
A quantity related to the equivalent width of the Hα line
The temperature of the emitting gas
